Dialogue.NPCText:
In the chill shade of Sunreach’s graveyard, a gaunt figure in tattered robes tends the crooked stones. His sunken eyes glance up—gray as old ash.

“You tread where silence reigns, stranger. I am Orin Mournwell, keeper of these graves... and of secrets that linger after the flesh is dust.

What do you seek among the dead? Rest, answers... or perhaps a task shunned by the living?”

Option.text: You seem troubled. What haunts you, gravekeeper?
I heard you know secrets beyond the grave.
Do you have any work for me?
Tell me about yourself, Orin.
Just passing by. Farewell.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Orin’s fingers tighten on his staff.

“The dead do not rest easy in these days. Their whispers twist on the desert wind—warning, begging, sometimes plotting. But I must heed them, for only the dead speak truths unclouded by politics or coin.

I search for the means to pierce their silence. There are herbs—rare, bitter things—that grow only where sand swallows the sun. With them, the veil lifts, and their counsel becomes clear.”

Option.text: These desert herbs… what are they for?
You seem to court dangerous arts.
I’ll leave you to your vigil.

Dialogue.NPCText:
A sad smile flickers on Orin’s lips.

“All wisdom comes at a cost. The living cling to ignorance; I seek what lies beyond. Minax’s cultists promised me forbidden rites in return for service. Yet I serve no master—not truly. Death is the only constant, and she keeps her own council.”

Option.text: Who do you truly serve, then?
Have you ever aided the living?
I wish to hear more of your work.
I should go.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Orin glances away.

“Sometimes. I have traded knowledge with Aria Silverhand, the city’s restless historian. She values the secrets I glean from beyond... though her heart is not yet ready for their price.
Do you wish to carry such burdens yourself?”

Option.text: Yes. I want to aid you—tell me what you need.
Not now.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Orin’s eyes glimmer.

“Whispers reach me from both sides of the grave, traveler. In Sunreach, all secrets are for sale—but mine must be earned. Fetch me what I require, and the dead themselves may answer your questions.
Will you brave the desert’s thirst for a gravekeeper’s favor?”

Option.text: What must I find for you?
I am not ready to traffic with the dead.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Seek for me the Ghostblossom—a pale flower found only where the desert touches ancient ruin, and the Wormwood Root, bitter as memory. With these, I can rouse the dead without their wrath.
Bring both to me, and I shall offer you what the living cannot.”

Option.text: I will find these herbs.
Why risk such forbidden rites?
I need time to think.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Orin’s voice drops to a rasp.

“Few dare what I ask. The Ghostblossom blooms in the haunted shadows of Qasaria’s old necropolis. The Wormwood Root grows where the ground is freshly turned by mourners—often in Sunreach’s own graveyard.

Find these two, and bring them here. But beware: Minax’s followers crave these herbs for rituals darker than mine. Should you fail, the dead will go unheeded… and perhaps grow restless.”

Option.text: I accept your quest. I will return with both herbs.
Tell me more of the dangers.
I am not ready for this task.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Good. Take this scroll—it marks what I require and where whispers say they grow.
Return only when you carry both Ghostblossom and Wormwood Root. The dead do not wait forever, nor do I.”

Option.text: I’ll return with the herbs.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Orin’s eyes glint, hollow and sharp.

“The old necropolis beyond Qasaria is a den of wraiths and cultists. Ghostblossom blooms only where grief lingers. Wormwood Root is guarded by those who would rather join the dead than let go of the past.
Worse still, Minax’s spies covet both for their own rites. If you are caught, do not speak my name.”

Option.text: Understood. I’ll be careful.
Perhaps this is too perilous.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Orin inspects the herbs, reverent.

“You have done what few dared. With these, I shall pierce the veil—and grant you the boon of the dead. Listen well: not all answers bring peace.”
He murmurs words in a forgotten tongue, shadows coiling at his feet.
You feel the chill of old secrets settle on your bones.

Option.text: What have I earned?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Orin presents you with a small black talisman.
“This is the Gravebound Token. It will let you commune once with the spirit of any fallen soul in Sunreach’s earth—or banish a minor undead who threatens the living.
You have my gratitude, and perhaps the gratitude of the restless dead.”

Option.text: Thank you, Orin.

Dialogue.NPCText: Orin nods silently and returns to his vigil, already half-absorbed in the world beyond.

Orin’s gaze turns inward, voice hollow.

“You would know me? Few ask. Fewer still stay to hear. But if you're willing…”
He pauses, studying you. “Very well. Ask, and I will offer truth. As much as the dead remember.”

Option.text: Were you always a gravekeeper?
Why do you consort with the dead?
What ties you to Sunreach?
I’ve heard whispers of your past with Minax...
That is enough for now.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“I once studied in Moonglow—when I still had warmth in my hands, and color in my dreams. But knowledge was gated, truth was hoarded, and death... death was ignored.”

“I left. Dug deeper. I buried my shame in the graveyards I came to tend. I found solace in silence, and... voices in the dark.”

He gives you a curious look.

Option.text: Did you lose someone to death?
Your story sounds like regret.
What did you learn from the dead?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Orin’s voice drops to a whisper.

“My sister. Alinwe. Struck down by fever. I tried everything. Charms, potions, incantations beyond my skill. When I failed, I swore: never again would death take without answer.”

You feel the weight of his vow press through the graveyard fog.

Option.text: Your pain is great… I respect your vow.
Loss drives many mad. Have you considered this?
Option.action: SendMessage:Orin’s eyes narrow, but he says nothing.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He nods once, slowly.

“Few understand. Fewer still listen. Thank you.”

A faint aura surrounds you, and a forgotten word settles into your memory.

Option.text: You honor her with your work.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Madness… or clarity few dare accept?” he rasps. “Go on, speak with ghosts before you call me broken.”

“Still, I will answer your questions. Curiosity is not a sin—yet.”

Option.text: Very well. Tell me what you've learned from the dead.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“All wisdom is born of regret. But mine is not paralyzing—it is purpose.”
“The living fear death. I... speak with her.”

He offers you a wry smile. “And sometimes, she answers.”

Option.text: You're more philosopher than necromancer.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Necromancy is but a name. The art I practice is listening. Each corpse is a vessel. Each grave a library.”

“Most see only rot and ruin. I see patterns, secrets, regrets. Even spells lost to time, waiting to be heard.”
“I collect them. Not for power. For memory.”

Option.text: Have you shared these secrets?
What’s the most dangerous thing the dead ever told you?

Dialogue.NPCText:
“To Aria Silverhand, yes. She knows how to listen, even if she doesn’t always like what she hears.”
“To others? No. Secrets are safest with the dead.”

Option.text: What secret do you guard most closely?

Dialogue.NPCText:
“They spoke of a cult beneath Sunreach. A circle of blood-bound priests who called Minax ‘Mother of Rebirth’. They prepare something... a ritual to shatter the soul itself.”

He grabs your arm.
“If you ever hear the phrase ‘Ash returns to ash’, run. Or kill them first.”

Option.text: I'll remember that.

Dialogue.NPCText:
He leans in, voice barely audible.

“There is a spirit buried in the noble crypts—one who knew Lord British before he vanished. The soul is bound, afraid. If I could free it…”
“But the Council forbids me. Even death bows to politics.”

Option.text: Perhaps I can help you someday.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Then perhaps not all in Sunreach are blind. If you ever hear the vault beneath House Veynar open... come find me. I will show you what lies forgotten.”

Orin straightens. “Enough stories for now. Thank you for listening.”

Option.text: Thank you for sharing, Orin.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Sunreach is full of graves and secrets—and not all are beneath the ground.”
“I stay because the city’s rot needs watching. If the dead ever rise... someone must remember their names.”

Option.text: You seem more protector than necromancer.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Minax offered me forbidden rites. I accepted. But not her chains.”

“I took her knowledge. Gave her lies. And in return, I learned that even the Queen of Destruction fears the final silence.”
Orin chuckles. “Would you believe... she has dreams?”

Option.text: Minax dreams? Of what?

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Of a time before the Gem shattered. Of being mortal. Of losing something she cannot name.”

“The dead whisper it: even immortals grieve.”

Option.text: Thank you for your truth, Orin.
